page.title: 04Pitscottie
page.content: Pitscottie is a hamlet three miles from Cupar. It has around twenty-five houses and buildings and a population of about sixty people. It is built on a crossroads. One of the roads runs from Ceres to St. Andrews and the other from Crail to Cupar. It is surrounded by farmland. Children go to Ceres Primary School by bus. Jute was once grown in the area and 100 years ago there was a linen mill in Dura Den which used Ceres burn for power. In Pitscottie now there is a garage, a bus hire service, a general store and an agricultural contractor's business. In the centre of Pitscottie is an attractive public house which sells midday meals to locals and tourists. Most of the homes are single storey, privately owned cottages. Pitscottie is a peaceful hamlet.
